newsitem.title: MEXICO: New Televisa chief promises no layoffs.
newsitem.headline: New Televisa chief promises no layoffs.

text.p: The new chief executive of Grupo Televisa, Emilio Azcarraga Jean, on Monday met with top company executives and assured them there would be no staff lay-offs, Televisa said.
"It was assured that Televisa will not have any staff cuts," the company said in a statement describing the meeting.
It also said Azcarraga Jean's father, Emilio Azcarraga Milmo, who stepped down as chairman last week due to sickness, was getting better.
Azcarraga Jean said he will set up a committee to analyse the decisions taken by firm's new leadership, which includes Guillermo Canedo White as chairman of Televisa's board.
Televisa, in a late night news broadcast on Monday, said each of the 500 executives had individual photographs taken with Azcarraga Jean and Canedo White.
